overview.summary: AFAS 2748, Applied Applications, offers an in-depth exploration of application principles within the context of African American Studies at the University of Houston.  Students cultivate critical thinking and problem-solving abilities through rigorous analysis.
learningObjectives: Analyze complex applications and their underlying principles
Develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Apply theoretical frameworks to practical scenarios
Evaluate the impact of applications on society

professors.teachingStyle: A combination of lectures, discussions, group work, and individual assignments is typically used
professors.availability: Office hours are typically held twice a week and professors are responsive to emails

statistics.enrollmentTrend: Stable; consistent enrollment over the past few years

careerProspects.salaryImpact: Improved prospects for jobs requiring strong analytical and problem-solving skills

bestFor: Students interested in social justice issues
studyTips: Seek help from the professor or TA when needed
recommendations.timeManagement: Prioritize tasks, create a weekly schedule, break down large assignments into smaller tasks

uniqueAspects: Focus on applications within the context of African American Studies
